headline: Huntington Stock Falls as Q4 Earnings Lag Estimates, Expenses Rise Y/Y
summary: HBAN stock plunges after Q4 earnings miss estimates due to a sharp year-over-year rise in expenses and credit provisions, which outweighed solid revenue and NII growth.

raw.headline: Huntington Stock Falls as Q4 Earnings Lag Estimates, Expenses Rise Y/Y
raw.summary: HBAN stock plunges after Q4 earnings miss estimates due to a sharp year-over-year rise in expenses and credit provisions, which outweighed solid revenue and NII growth.

headline: Old National Bancorp Among 3 Value Stocks Priced Below Estimated Worth
summary: As the U.S. stock market rebounds with major indices like the Dow Jones and S&P 500 posting gains, investors are keenly observing opportunities amidst eased geopolitical tensions and stable economic indicators. In this environment, identifying undervalued stocks becomes crucial, as they present potential value by trading below their estimated worth while offering resilience against market fluctuations.

headline: Huntington (HBAN) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Beginning on slide three, as we enter 2026, the year of Huntington's 160th anniversary, it's a moment of pride, but even more a moment of anticipation.  Nearly every part of Huntington is performing at a high level, creating powerful momentum as we look to the future.

headline: Huntington Bancshares: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Columbus, Ohio-based bank said it had earnings of 30 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 37 cents per share. The results missed Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Huntington Bancshares: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The Columbus, Ohio-based bank said it had earnings of 30 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 37 cents per share. The results missed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated Reports 2025 Fourth-Quarter Earnings
summary: Huntington Bancshares Incorporated (Nasdaq: HBAN) reported net income for the 2025 fourth quarter of $519 million, or $0.30 per common share, a decrease of $110 million, or 17%, from the prior quarter, and a decrease of $11 million, or 2%, from the year-ago quarter, inclusive of $130 million of pre-tax notable items in the 2025 fourth quarter, primarily due to acquisition-related expenses.

headline: January 2026's Stocks That May Be Trading Below Estimated Value
summary: Amid recent market volatility, the U.S. stock indices have shown resilience with a sharp rebound following geopolitical tensions and tariff threats. As investors navigate these fluctuations, identifying stocks that may be trading below their estimated value can present opportunities for those looking to capitalize on potential market inefficiencies.
